title: ARAM is a complete joke.
body:
three robots randomly commit suicide on each team while 4 people curse and swear about their suicidal robot team mates. 
ARAM in a nut shell.

replies.body: ARAM was a joke mode that the community had come up with in the first place anyway.

Bots are bots. They are on the rift too, it's not unique to arams.
70% of my games were in aram last year, and I promise that bots are not that common.
I have played at least 3 games of ARAM and out of three games at least three players were bots.
Perhaps this is simply a burden of your mmr? Bots don't climb after all :)
I've had about six ARAMs tonight alone and I have not seen a single bot.
You are not lv 11 and subjected to bot boosting games though are you.

its unfair, some one gets skrewed out of a win because some lazy bastard didn't think they "Earned" the rank they earned so, they make a new account and robot it up only to have the same thing happen. I have been watching a lot of youtube videos and brickyorchid says if you are still in bronze after 50 ranked games you are exactly where you deserve to be. 

Plain and simple. the are spoiled brats who want the skill but refuse to learn.
People don't use bots to climb though, they use them to level up their accounts to 30.

Well we have now discovered what the problem is :) Once you reach level 30, you'll be quite a bit above the standard bot level and won't be seeing them anywhere near as much :)

You won't be level 11 forever, my dude :)
Nothing to do with being above bot level standard, its to do with that bot finishing its grind and therefore being ready to sell, meaning the account has been turned over from a bot to human hands.
By which point the bot would have been reported multiple times and been banned.
Look at the level, then realise bots are very common in aram until higher levels.

it completely ruins the experience for every single new player like myself. that and when high level players have a second account just for the purpose of destroying players that can barely walk around much less effectively use their abilitys.

> [{quoted}](name=AngelBird,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=ENljuTHo,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2017-01-06T23:45:02.082+0000)
>
> it completely ruins the experience for every single new player like myself. that and when high level players have a second account just for the purpose of destroying players that can barely walk around much less effectively use their abilities.

You can learn a lot from seeing a smurf though. If you get wrecked on the rift by someone who has the same gold, xp and player level as you, you get an example of how you can improve.

 Try and make the most of your journey, learn from everything you can :)

Forgot mentioning they can't spell basic words either, with some bad grammar mixed in. I swear computers have warnings showing when you misspell a word...

Screwed. Abilities.


Also.

>Plain and simple. the are spoiled brats who want the skill but refuse to learn.

That is exactly what people playing yasuo are, so they always feed.

This is our reward for playing the game longer than you. We get better. I'm generally bad at tryndamere, but played him on my smurf for the first time in like 6 months last night and got a straight up S. Sure, its not fun for you low level guys, but when we joined, it took 3x as much XP to get to level 30. So our reward now is stomping on noobs to our hearts' content.

Its those beautiful girls on the other side of the bridge

they got them suicidal

suicidal

when they say its over

Bots in aram are the least of the problems. ARAM's biggest problem is the random setup. Most of the games look the same, one team gets good cc dmg and range and poke the other gets weak CC no burst dmg and no poke. ARAM is 80% setup 10% luck and the rest is ur input in a match.

Did I miss the part where ARAM was meant to be serious? 
And when someone brags about smurfing and getting an S all I think of is a inbred, narcissistic, basement dwelling bully who would pick on someone IRL and think it makes them look cool.

with the talk of aram seriousness, does it still count as a earned pentakill if i get it on legend of the poro king?, what if i almost get 2 but the second was ks by a jinx ult, do the penta's count then?
Serious or jovial wasn't really up for debate. We are discussing bots :P
guys, frequency of bots is all about time the closer to 3am the more likely bots are
welcome to league.
